noun.description: A further competition, election, race, etc., after a tie or inconclusive result.
examples: he won only 49 percent of the vote, so a runoff will be held

noun.description: The draining away of water (or substances carried in it) from the surface of an area of land, a building or structure, etc.
examples: the ratio of runoff to rainfall
fertilizer runoff from the intensively farmed areas in the river basin
